CLIENT_CONNECT_WITH_DB.name: CLIENT_CONNECT_WITH_DB
CLIENT_CONNECT_WITH_DB.short_desc: One can specify db on connect.

CLIENT_SESSION_TRACK.name: CLIENT_SESSION_TRACK
CLIENT_SESSION_TRACK.short_desc: Expects the server to send sesson-state changes.

Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\ColumnDefinition.name: Plasma\Drivers\MySQL\ColumnDefinition
Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\ColumnDefinition.short_desc: Column Definitions define columns (who would've thought of that?). Such as their name, type, length, etc.

isAutoIncrement.name: isAutoIncrement
isAutoIncrement.short_desc: Whether the column is auto incremented.

isMultipleKey.name: isMultipleKey
isMultipleKey.short_desc: Whether the column is part of a multiple/composite key.

isNullable.name: isNullable
isNullable.short_desc: Whether the column is nullable (not `NOT NULL`).

isPrimaryKey.name: isPrimaryKey
isPrimaryKey.short_desc: Whether the column is the primary key.

isUniqueKey.name: isUniqueKey
isUniqueKey.short_desc: Whether the column is the unique key.

isUnsigned.name: isUnsigned
isUnsigned.short_desc: Whether the column is unsigned (only makes sense for numeric types).

isZerofilled.name: isZerofilled
isZerofilled.short_desc: Whether the column gets zerofilled to the length.

Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\DriverFactory.name: Plasma\Drivers\MySQL\DriverFactory
Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\DriverFactory.short_desc: The Driver Factory is responsible for creating the driver correctly.

__construct.name: __construct
__construct.long_desc:
The driver supports the following options:
```
array(
    'connector' => ConnectorInstance, (a custom connector instance, which MUST return a `Connection` instance from the `react/socket` package)
    'characters.set' => string, (the character set to use, defaults to utf8mb4)
    'characters.collate' => string, (the collate to use, defaults to the charset default)
    'compression.enable' => bool, (whether compression should be used if available, defaults to true)
    'localInFile.enable' => bool, (whether local in file requests are enabled, defaults to false, see issue #16)
    'tls.context' => array, (socket TLS context options)
    'tls.force' => bool, (whether non-localhost connections are forced to use TLS, defaults to true)
    'tls.forceLocal' => bool, (whether localhost connections are forced to use TLS, defaults to false)
)
```

addAuthPlugin.name: addAuthPlugin
addAuthPlugin.short_desc: Adds an auth plugin. `$condition` is either an int (for server capabilities), or a string (for auth plugin name).

getFilesystem.name: getFilesystem
getFilesystem.short_desc: Get the React Filesystem, or null. The filesystem must be set by the user, in order to not get `null`.

setFilesystem.name: setFilesystem
setFilesystem.short_desc: Set the React Filesystem to use.

BLOB_FLAG.name: BLOB_FLAG
BLOB_FLAG.short_desc: Whether the column is a blob. Still not the google ones.

ENUM_FLAG.name: ENUM_FLAG
ENUM_FLAG.short_desc: Whether the column is an enum.

FIELD_TYPE_BLOB.name: FIELD_TYPE_BLOB
FIELD_TYPE_BLOB.short_desc: Blob. Not the google ones. Binary.

FIELD_TYPE_GEOMETRY.name: FIELD_TYPE_GEOMETRY
FIELD_TYPE_GEOMETRY.short_desc: Geometry. You know, some sort of witchcraft.

MULTIPLE_KEY_FLAG.name: MULTIPLE_KEY_FLAG
MULTIPLE_KEY_FLAG.short_desc: Whether the column is part of a key.

NOT_NULL_FLAG.name: NOT_NULL_FLAG
NOT_NULL_FLAG.short_desc: Whether the column can not be `NULL`.

PRI_KEY_FLAG.name: PRI_KEY_FLAG
PRI_KEY_FLAG.short_desc: Whether the column is a primary key.

SET_FLAG.name: SET_FLAG
SET_FLAG.short_desc: Whether the column is a set.

TIMESTAMP_FLAG.name: TIMESTAMP_FLAG
TIMESTAMP_FLAG.short_desc: Whether the column is a timestamp.

TYPE_MAP.name: TYPE_MAP
TYPE_MAP.short_desc: Maps the int to the type name.
source:
const TYPE_MAP = array(
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_DECIMAL => 'DECIMAL',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_TINY => 'TINY',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_SHORT => 'SHORT',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_LONG => 'LONG',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_FLOAT => 'FLOAT',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_DOUBLE => 'DOUBLE',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_NULL => 'NULL',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_TIMESTAMP => 'TIMESTAMP',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_LONGLONG => 'LONGLONG',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_INT24 => 'INT24',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_DATE => 'DATE',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_TIME => 'TIME',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_DATETIME => 'DATETIME',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_YEAR => 'YEAR',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_NEWDATE => 'NEWDATE',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_VARCHAR => 'VARCHAR',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_BIT => 'BIT',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_JSON => 'JSON',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_NEWDECIMAL => 'NEWDECIMAL',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_ENUM => 'ENUM',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_SET => 'SET',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_TINY_BLOB => 'TINYBLOB',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_MEDIUM_BLOB => 'MEDIUMBLOB',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_LONG_BLOB => 'LONGBLOB',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_BLOB => 'BLOB',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_VAR_STRING => 'VARSTRING',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_STRING => 'STRING',
    FieldFlags::FIELD_TYPE_GEOMETRY => 'GEOMETRY'
);

UNIQUE_KEY_FLAG.name: UNIQUE_KEY_FLAG
UNIQUE_KEY_FLAG.short_desc: Whether the column must be unique.

ZEROFILL_FLAG.name: ZEROFILL_FLAG
ZEROFILL_FLAG.short_desc: Whether the column will be filled with zeroes to the column length.

Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\Messages\\AuthMo.name: Plasma\Drivers\MySQL\Messages\AuthMoreDataMessage
Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\Messages\\AuthMo.short_desc: Represents an Auth More Data Message.

Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\Messages\\AuthSw.name: Plasma\Drivers\MySQL\Messages\AuthSwitchRequestMessage
Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\Messages\\AuthSw.short_desc: Represents an Auth Switch Request Message.

Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\Messages\\LocalI.name: Plasma\Drivers\MySQL\Messages\LocalInFileRequestMessage
Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\Messages\\LocalI.short_desc: Represents a Local In File Data Message.

getID.name: getID
getID.short_desc: Get the identifier for the packet.

getParser.name: getParser
getParser.short_desc: Get the parser which created this message.

parseMessage.name: parseMessage
parseMessage.short_desc: Parses the message, once the complete string has been received.
parseMessage.long_desc: Return false if not enough data has been received.

setParserState.name: setParserState
setParserState.short_desc: Sets the parser state, if necessary. If not, return `-1`.

affectedRows.name: affectedRows
affectedRows.short_desc: Count of affected rows by the last query.

info.name: info
info.short_desc: Human readable status information, if any.

lastInsertedID.name: lastInsertedID
lastInsertedID.short_desc: Last inserted ID by the last `INSERT` query.

sessionStateChanges.name: sessionStateChanges
sessionStateChanges.short_desc: Server session state changes, if any.

Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\Messages\\ParseE.name: Plasma\Drivers\MySQL\Messages\ParseException
Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\Messages\\ParseE.short_desc: Represents an exception during message parsing.

Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\Messages\\Prepar.name: Plasma\Drivers\MySQL\Messages\PrepareStatementOkMessage
Plasma\\Drivers\\MySQL\\Messages\\Prepar.short_desc: Represents a Prepare Statement Ok Message.

__destruct.name: __destruct
__destruct.short_desc: Destructor. Runs once the instance goes out of scope.
__destruct.long_desc:
Please do not rely on the destructor to properly close your statement.
ALWAYS explicitely close the statement once you're done.

close.name: close
close.short_desc: Closes the prepared statement and frees the associated resources on the server.
close.long_desc: Closing a statement more than once has no effect.

execute.name: execute
execute.short_desc: Executes the prepared statement. Resolves with a `QueryResult` instance.
exceptions: Thrown if the statement is executed after it has been closed, or thrown for insufficent or missing parameters.

getID.name: getID
getID.short_desc: Get the driver-dependent ID of this statement.
getID.long_desc: The return type can be of ANY type, as the ID depends on the driver and DBMS.

isClosed.name: isClosed
isClosed.short_desc: Whether the statement has been closed.

runQuery.name: runQuery
runQuery.short_desc: Runs the given querybuilder on the underlying driver instance. However the query will be ignored, only the parameters are used.
runQuery.long_desc:
The driver CAN throw an exception if the given querybuilder is not supported.
An example would be a SQL querybuilder and a Cassandra driver.

__destruct.name: __destruct
__destruct.short_desc: Destructor. Runs once the instance goes out of scope.
__destruct.long_desc:
Please do not rely on the destructor to properly close your cursor.
ALWAYS explicitely close the cursor once you're done.

close.name: close
close.short_desc: Closes the cursor and frees the associated resources on the server.
close.long_desc: Closing a cursor more than once has no effect.

fetch.name: fetch
fetch.short_desc: Fetches the given amount of rows using the cursor. Resolves with the row, an array of rows (if amount > 1), or false if no more results exist.
exceptions: Thrown if the driver or DBMS does not support cursors.
Thrown if the underlying statement has been closed.

isClosed.name: isClosed
isClosed.short_desc: Whether the cursor has been closed.

SERVER_STATUS_CURSOR_EXISTS.name: SERVER_STATUS_CURSOR_EXISTS
SERVER_STATUS_CURSOR_EXISTS.short_desc: Used by Binary Protocol Resultset to signal that COM_STMT_FETCH must be used to fetch the row-data.

SERVER_STATUS_NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES.name: SERVER_STATUS_NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES
SERVER_STATUS_NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES.short_desc: Backslashes are not allowed for escaping.

SERVER_STATUS_NO_GOOD_INDEX_USED.name: SERVER_STATUS_NO_GOOD_INDEX_USED
SERVER_STATUS_NO_GOOD_INDEX_USED.short_desc: The database was unable to use a performant index.

SERVER_STATUS_NO_INDEX_USED.name: SERVER_STATUS_NO_INDEX_USED
SERVER_STATUS_NO_INDEX_USED.short_desc: The database was unable to use a index.
